body.p:
Cadiz Ky
22d Jany 1861
To His Excellency B. Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir

By reference to the records of my office I find that the fine against Jno R Grace who was jointly indicted with Mr Greenwade for betting on the Election has been remitted by your Excellency in Consideration of that fact and the facts set forth in the foregoing petition I would most respectfully ask a remittal of the fine against Mr Greenwade, also.

Yr friend
R A. Burnett
Clerk Trigg Cir. Court
To His Excellency the Hon B Magoffin

Your petitioner Isaac Greenwade would humbly state and represent that at the Feby Term of our Trigg Circuit Court 1860 there was Judgment rendered by default against him of One Hundred Dollars upon indictment for betting on elections. He and your other petitioners whose signatures are here to affixed would also represent that said betting was upon a clearly heated local election on matters of local and county interest. that same was induced & brought on by the heated personal excitement incident to the peculiar circumstances. your petitioner would represent and upon your honor that they are satisfied and feel a high degree of confidence in saying that Mr Isaac Greenwade you made immediate petition and did not nor would under any circumstance make said wager or any other for purpose of improperly effecting the vote of any citizen voter of this Commonwealth, Nor would he use any degree of influence contrary to the Spirit of the laws denounced against wagers on elections. and your petitioners while holding said laws in the main beneficial checks on such a practice would yet represent this as a cause right and proper for the interference of Executive clemency as far as may be in such causes and would therefore pray your honor for a release and discharge of so much of said fine as by law permitted in this will in duty ever &c.

Jno R Grace P. J. T. C. C.
